Structs/ClientCredential.html#/s:14AtomN.name: grantType
Structs/ClientCredential.html#/s:14AtomN.abstract: The authorization grant type as described in Sections 4.1.3, 4.3.2, 4.4.2, RFC 6749. Starting with

Structs/ClientCredential.html#/s:14AtomN.name: id
Structs/ClientCredential.html#/s:14AtomN.abstract: The client identifier issued to the client during the registration process described in Section 2.2, RFC 6749.

Structs/ClientCredential.html#/s:14AtomN.name: secret
Structs/ClientCredential.html#/s:14AtomN.abstract: The client secret. The client MAY omit the parameter if the client secret is an empty string. See RFC 6749.

Structs/ClientCredential.html#/s:14AtomN.name: init(grantType:id:secret:)
Structs/ClientCredential.html#/s:14AtomN.abstract: Creates a ClientCredential instance given the provided parameter(s).

Structs/URLPath.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: Creates a URLPath instance given the provided parameter(s).

Structs/TokenCredential.html#/s:14AtomNe.name: accessToken
Structs/TokenCredential.html#/s:14AtomNe.abstract: The access token as defined in OAuth 2.0 spec.

Structs/TokenCredential.html#/s:14AtomNe.name: expiresAt
Structs/TokenCredential.html#/s:14AtomNe.abstract: The expiration date of the access token.

Structs/TokenCredential.html#/s:14AtomNe.name: refreshToken
Structs/TokenCredential.html#/s:14AtomNe.abstract: The refresh token as defined in OAuth 2.0 spec.

Structs/TokenCredential.html#/s:14AtomNe.abstract: Creates a TokenCredential instance given the provided parameter(s).

Structs/TokenCredential.html#/s:14AtomNe.name: init(from:)
Structs/TokenCredential.html#/s:14AtomNe.abstract: Initializes an instance by decoding from a decoder, handling both local and service-sourced token data.

Structs/TokenCredential.html#/s:14AtomNe.name: encode(to:)
Structs/TokenCredential.html#/s:14AtomNe.abstract: Encodes this instance into an encoder, saving the accessToken, expiresAt, and refreshToken.

Structs/BaseURL.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: Creates a BaseURL instance given the provided parameter(s).

Structs/AtomResponse.html#/s:14AtomNetwo.name: success
Structs/AtomResponse.html#/s:14AtomNetwo.abstract: Returns default, success response where status code is 200.

Structs/AtomResponse.html#/s:14AtomNetwo.name: isFailure
Structs/AtomResponse.html#/s:14AtomNetwo.abstract: Returns true if the status code of the AtomResponse is not in 200...299 range.

Structs/AtomResponse.html#/s:14AtomNetwo.name: isSuccess
Structs/AtomResponse.html#/s:14AtomNetwo.abstract: Returns true if the status code of the AtomResponse is in 200...299 range.

Structs/Atom.html#/s:14AtomNetworking0A0.abstract: Creates a Atom instance given the provided parameter(s).

Structs/Atom.html#/s:14AtomNetworking0A0.name: didFailToRefreshAccessToken
Structs/Atom.html#/s:14AtomNetworking0A0.abstract: Notification name posted when an attempt to refresh the access token fails.

Structs/Atom.html#/s:14AtomNetworking0A0.name: didFailToAuthorizeRequest
Structs/Atom.html#/s:14AtomNetworking0A0.abstract: Notification name posted when an attempt to authorize the request fails.

Structs/AtomResponse.html.name: AtomResponse
Structs/AtomResponse.html.abstract: The metadata associated with the response to a URL load request, independent of protocol and URL scheme.

Structs/BaseURL.html.name: BaseURL
Structs/BaseURL.html.abstract: Model object representing base URL composed from URL scheme and host.

Structs/TokenCredential.html.name: TokenCredential
Structs/TokenCredential.html.abstract: The TokenCredential type declares an object used by Atom in network requests that require bearer authentication.

Structs/AuthorizationEndpoint.html.name: AuthorizationEndpoint
Structs/AuthorizationEndpoint.html.abstract: Model object representing the location of the authorization server.

Structs/BasicCredential.html.name: BasicCredential
Structs/BasicCredential.html.abstract: The BasicCredential type declares an object used by Atom in network requests that require basic authentication. Before

Structs/ClientCredential.html.name: ClientCredential
Structs/ClientCredential.html.abstract: The ClientCredential type declares an object used by Atom for automated refreshing of the access token.

Structs/HeaderItem.html.name: HeaderItem
Structs/HeaderItem.html.abstract: A single name-value pair from the header portion of a request.

Structs/QueryItem.html.name: QueryItem
Structs/QueryItem.html.abstract: A single name-value pair from the query portion of a URL.

Protocols/Requestable.html#/s:14AtomNetw.name: headerItems
Protocols/Requestable.html#/s:14AtomNetw.abstract: The array of header items to apply to a URLRequest.

Protocols/Requestable.html#/s:14AtomNetw.name: method
Protocols/Requestable.html#/s:14AtomNetw.abstract: The HTTP method to apply to a URLRequest.

Protocols/Requestable.html#/s:14AtomNetw.name: queryItems
Protocols/Requestable.html#/s:14AtomNetw.abstract: The array of query items to apply to a URL.

Protocols/Requestable.html#/s:14AtomNetw.name: requiresAuthorization
Protocols/Requestable.html#/s:14AtomNetw.abstract: The Bool indicating whether or not authorization header should be applied

Protocols/Requestable.html#/s:14AtomNetw.name: path()
Protocols/Requestable.html#/s:14AtomNetw.abstract: The URL path to append to a base URL.

Protocols/BasicCredentialConvertible.htm.name: BasicCredentialConvertible
Protocols/BasicCredentialConvertible.htm.abstract: The BasicCredentialConvertible protocol declares an interface used for converting conforming type to BasicCredential.

Protocols/ClientCredentialConvertible.ht.name: ClientCredentialConvertible
Protocols/ClientCredentialConvertible.ht.abstract: The ClientCredentialConvertible protocol declares an interface used for converting conforming type to ClientCredential.

Protocols.html#/s:14AtomNetworking5Model.name: Model
Protocols.html#/s:14AtomNetworking5Model.abstract: The Model protocol declares an interface used as a generic constraint on Service methods.

Protocols/Requestable.html.name: Requestable
Protocols/Requestable.html.abstract: The Requestable protocol declares an interface used for initializing network request object.

Protocols/RequestableItem.html.name: RequestableItem
Protocols/RequestableItem.html.abstract: The RequestableItem protocol declares an interface used for specifying HTTP header values & request queries.

Protocols/TokenCredentialWritable.html.name: TokenCredentialWritable
Protocols/TokenCredentialWritable.html.abstract: The TokenCredentialWritable protocol declares an interface used for reading from / writing to TokenCredential.

Extensions/URLSessionTaskMetrics.html#/c.name: debugDescription
Extensions/URLSessionTaskMetrics.html#/c.abstract: Returns a textual representation of this instance, suitable for debugging.

Extensions/URLSessionTask.html#/c:@CM@At.name: debugDescription
Extensions/URLSessionTask.html#/c:@CM@At.abstract: Returns a textual representation of this instance, suitable for debugging.

Extensions/URLResponse.html#/s:So13NSURL.name: isFailure
Extensions/URLResponse.html#/s:So13NSURL.abstract: Returns true if the status code of the HTTPURLResponse is not in 200...299 range.

Extensions/URLResponse.html#/s:So13NSURL.name: isSuccess
Extensions/URLResponse.html#/s:So13NSURL.abstract: Returns true if the status code of the HTTPURLResponse is in 200...299 range.

Extensions/URLResponse.html#/c:@CM@AtomN.name: debugDescription
Extensions/URLResponse.html#/c:@CM@AtomN.abstract: Returns a textual representation of this instance, suitable for debugging.

Extensions/Array.html.name: Array
Extensions/Array.html.abstract: Adds the ability to specify an array as the expected decoded type.

Extensions.html#/s:10Foundation4DataV.name: Data
Extensions.html#/s:10Foundation4DataV.abstract: Conforming Data type to Model protocol allows it to be used where Model is expected.

Enums/SessionConfiguration.html#/s:14Ato.name: background(_:)
Enums/SessionConfiguration.html#/s:14Ato.abstract: The background session configuration is suitable for transferring data files while the app runs in the background.

Enums/SessionConfiguration.html#/s:14Ato.name: default
Enums/SessionConfiguration.html#/s:14Ato.abstract: The default session configuration that uses a persistent disk-based cache.

Enums/SessionConfiguration.html#/s:14Ato.name: ephemeral
Enums/SessionConfiguration.html#/s:14Ato.abstract: Ephemeral configuration doesn’t store caches, credential stores, or any session-related data on disk (RAM only).

Enums/GrantType.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.name: refreshToken
Enums/GrantType.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: The refresh_token grant type as defined in Sections 6.0, RFC 6749.

Enums/AuthenticationMethod.html#/s:14Ato.name: basic(_:)
Enums/AuthenticationMethod.html#/s:14Ato.abstract: Atom will apply basic authorization header to a request on behalf of the client.

Enums/AuthenticationMethod.html#/s:14Ato.name: bearer(_:_:_:)
Enums/AuthenticationMethod.html#/s:14Ato.abstract: Atom will manage access token expiration and apply authorization header to a request on behalf of the client.

Enums/AuthenticationMethod.html#/s:14Ato.name: none
Enums/AuthenticationMethod.html#/s:14Ato.abstract: Application will manage its own authorization headers.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:14AtomNetworkin.name: delete
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:14AtomNetworkin.abstract: Use for deleting a resource identified by a URI.

Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:14AtomNetworkin.name: get
Enums/HTTPMethod.html#/s:14AtomNetworkin.abstract: Use for reading (or retrieving) a representation of a resource.

Enums/RequestableError.html#/s:14AtomNet.name: invalidBaseURL
Enums/RequestableError.html#/s:14AtomNet.abstract: Base URL failed validation. Most probable cause is invalid URL host.

Enums/RequestableError.html#/s:14AtomNet.name: invalidURL
Enums/RequestableError.html#/s:14AtomNet.abstract: URLComponents initialization with provided URL string failed.

Enums/AtomError.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.name: response(_:)
Enums/AtomError.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: Service returned invalid response where the status code is not in 200...299 range.

Enums/AtomError.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.name: isAuthorizationFailure
Enums/AtomError.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: Returns Bool indicating whether the error is due to an invalid or expired access token.

Enums/AtomError.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.name: isAccessTokenRefreshFailure
Enums/AtomError.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: Returns Bool indicating whether the error is due to a failed attempt to refresh an access token.

Enums/AtomError.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.name: decodeIfPresent(as:)
Enums/AtomError.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: Convenience method for decoding error object or message returned by the service.

Enums/AtomError.html.name: AtomError
Enums/AtomError.html.abstract: List of all possible error cases thrown by Atom framework.

Enums/RequestableError.html.name: RequestableError
Enums/RequestableError.html.abstract: List of all possible error cases thrown when conversion from Requestable to URLRequest fails.

Enums/AuthenticationMethod.html.name: AuthenticationMethod
Enums/AuthenticationMethod.html.abstract: List of authentication methods a client can choose from for Atom configuration.

Classes/Service.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.name: update(with:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: Enqueues an update operation with a requestable object, returning self for chaining.

Classes/Service.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.name: resume(expecting:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: Asynchronous overload of resume expecting a decodable model type.

Classes/Service.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.name: resume()
Classes/Service.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: Asynchronous overload of resume for a raw response, using a provided requestable.

Classes/Service.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.name: resume(expecting:completion:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: Completion-based overload of resume expecting a decodable model type.

Classes/Service.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.name: resume(_:)
Classes/Service.html#/s:14AtomNetworking.abstract: Completion-based overload of resume for a raw response.

Classes/Service.html.name: Service
Classes/Service.html.abstract: A wrapper class for managing service operations with serialized task queuing.
